input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: DG TRANSPORT MARITIME. Summary: Consultancy in the Field of Dangerous Goods in the Maritime Sector. Description: This contract concerns the recruitment of expertise for missions linked to dangerous goods in the maritime sector, in particular to enable the maritime transport of new types of goods, whether liquid goods, in solid bulk or packaged. This also includes answering technical questions and providing interpretations to users regarding the IMDG Code, IMSBC Code, IBC Code and MARPOL Annex II. In addition, this expertise will facilitate the analysis of technical requests and proposals as well as the provision of opinions. Category (CPV code): General public services (75110000). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BRUSSELS CAPITAL REGION. Summary: Study of Business Officers. Description: STIB wishes to collaborate with a bailiff's office, mainly for services related to the recovery of commercial debts, legal surcharges imposed on fraudulent travelers on vehicles and in spaces operated by STIB, as well as administrative fines. The assignment concerns the handling of cases in the amicable settlement phase and/or in a judicial phase.<br> The assignment may also relate to any other task reserved by law for bailiffs, such as drawing up reports.<br> STIB itself arranges for the collection of a portion (approximately 40%) of the amounts due to it. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: GENT. Summary: Info Coaches for a Positive, Liveable and Healthy Nightlife in Overpoortbuurt. Description: The Overpoortbuurt is the student entertainment area par excellence. The mass of visitors increases the risk of nuisance problems such as noise, urination, waste, verbal and physical aggression, (sexual) inappropriate behavior, etc., often facilitated by excessive alcohol consumption and drug use. The assignment includes: Info coaches must create a positive atmosphere and help keep nightlife nuisance and problems within limits with a personal approach tailored to the needs of the goers. They must inform visitors about the applicable safety, quality of life and health measures and motivate them to do so to behave 'good' and take care of each other, themselves and the environment. They are in close contact with emergency services and provide targeted and timely referrals if necessary. Info coaches do not perform monitoring activities.<br> Category (CPV code): Provision of services to the community (75200000). Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-12-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, INTPA - INTERNATIONAL PARTNERSHIPS. Summary: Supply of Passive Autocatalytic Hydrogen Recombiners and Hydrogen Monitoring System for Armenian Nuclear Power Plant Unit 2. Description: Supply of Passive Autocatalytic Hydrogen Recombiners (Lot 1) and a Hydrogen Monitoring System (Lot 2) for the confinement of Armenian Nuclear Power Plant Unit 2. The national action plan of Armenia to improve the nuclear safety of the Armenian Nuclear Power Plant (ANPP) based on lessons learned from the Fukushima-Daiichi accident, peer reviewed by the European Nuclear Safety Regulators Group (ENSREG), includes an action point on implementation of measures to reduce hydrogen hazard probability and the measurement of hydrogen concentration in the containment of ANPP Unit 2. This supply tender aims to contract supplier(s) of equipment and associated services for hydrogen management in the containment of ANPP Unit 2. Lot 1: Design, manufacture and supply of a set of Passive Autocatalytic Hydrogen Recombiners and auxiliary tools. The tentative total rated depletion rate of the set shall be no less than 105 kg/h. Lot 2: Design, manufacture and supply of a Hydrogen Monitoring System and auxiliaries. For both lots, the Armenian Nuclear Power Plant will, amongst others, be responsible for the installation and commissioning of the equipment under supervision of the selected supplier(s). <br> Doc Title: Supply of Passive Autocatalytic Hydrogen Recombiners and Hydrogen Monitoring System for Armenian Nuclear Power Plant Unit 2 <br> Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-10-01. Closing Date: 2025-11-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Summary: Supply of Passive Autocatalytic Hydrogen Recombiners and Hydrogen Monitoring System for Armenian Nuclear Power Plant Unit 2
output.Description: Supply of Passive Autocatalytic Hydrogen Recombiners (Lot 1) and a Hydrogen Monitoring System (Lot 2) for the confinement of Armenian Nuclear Power Plant Unit 2. The national action plan of Armenia to improve the nuclear safety of the Armenian Nuclear Power Plant (ANPP) based on lessons learned from the Fukushima-Daiichi accident, peer reviewed by the European Nuclear Safety Regulators Group (ENSREG), includes an action point on implementation of measures to reduce hydrogen hazard probability and the measurement of hydrogen concentration in the containment of ANPP Unit 2. This supply tender aims to contract supplier(s) of equipment and associated services for hydrogen management in the containment of ANPP Unit 2. Lot 1: Design, manufacture and supply of a set of Passive Autocatalytic Hydrogen Recombiners and auxiliary tools. The tentative total rated depletion rate of the set shall be no less than 105 kg/h. Lot 2: Design, manufacture and supply of a Hydrogen Monitoring System and auxiliaries. For both lots, the Armenian Nuclear Power Plant will, amongst others, be responsible for the installation and commissioning of the equipment under supervision of the selected supplier(s). <br> Doc Title: Supply of Passive Autocatalytic Hydrogen Recombiners and Hydrogen Monitoring System for Armenian Nuclear Power Plant Unit 2 <br> Contract Type: supplies
output.Sub_Sector: Security, Fire Fighting, Police and Defence

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN DEFENCE AGENCY. Summary: Multi Mission Unmanned Aircraft System (25.Cap.Op.033). Description: The key objective of the project is to support the development of a fixed-wing Multi Mission Unmanned Aircraft System (M2UAS), capable of performing different types of mission depending on its configuration and/or payloads. This M2UAS concept shall include the feasibility of the different operational capabilities envisaged for the UAS platform (C4ISTAR, ALE , EW, AAR) with a phased approach. The project shall be conceived under a Concept Development and Experimentation (CD&E) approach to prove the concept with different scenarios, and may include system and sub-systems demonstrators. The General Objective is further detailed with the following specific objectives (SO): SO1.Describing the possible conceptual approach and minimum mission requirements for the development of M2UAS, with an initial focus on persistent category (long-endurance missions, platforms, systems and weapons), including fully autonomous systems. SO2.Identifying and analysing technology challenges related to the development of a M2UAS for military purposes, deriving from existing and envisaged platforms and related capabilities. SO3.Detecting the limiting factors for a common UAS platform with different payloads and the levels of effectiveness on different types of missions, focussing on C4ISTAR tasks at operational level. SO4.Recommending principles of systems engineering/design with a focus on assuring the cost effectiveness of the M2UAS with the envisaged capabilities, including the family concept of .... Tender Value: 1100000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-08-18. Closing Date: 2025-10-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Defence Agency (EDA)

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR NATURE AND FOREST. Summary: Framework Agreement for Supplying Learning Path Signs and Information Boards for Anb Domains. Description: The Agency for Nature and Forest manages more than 70,000 hectares of parks, forests and nature reserves in Flanders. In these domains we want to pursue an active reception policy and welcome the visitor as a good host. To steer this in the right direction, the Agency for Nature and Forest places information boards (often with maps) at the most important entrances to the domains. In this way the visitor immediately has a clear picture of what he can expect in the domain. This assignment embraces the delivery of the learning path signs and information boards for ANB domains. Is a framework agreement with 2 plots: plot 1 - delivering learning path signs, and plot 2: delivering information boards. The plots can be extended max. 3 times. There are various delivery locations spread across Flanders, see the details in the specifications. Category (CPV code): Information Panels (35261000). Published Date: 2025-08-14. Closing Date: 2025-09-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: MINISTRE DE LA DFENSE. Summary: Invitation to Submit an Application for Participation Regarding the Supply of 02 (Ea) Litter Pallets Fitted for A400m Atlas. Description: The present contract concerns the supply of 02 EA Litter Pallets fitted for A400M ATLAS. This purchase will provide a Pallet Based MEDEVAC capacity for transporting recumbent medium and low care patients in the cargo area of the Belgian/Luxembourg A400M fleet. The capacity envisaged is 12 patients with a maximum of 6 patients per Litter Pallet. Both Litter Pallets should be designed for modular use. The Litter Pallets must be designed and certified in accordance with the specific technical and logistic requirements. These requirements will be communicated, after the selection phase, in the second phase of this procurement procedure through the specifications. Current hydrants remain in place and are, if necessary, Completed by disadvours (RIA). o The contracting authority must be able to remotely control the services provided by service location (monitoring of commands and maintenance, download of verification slips, download of insurance certificates, download of extinguisher parks) via an application or online site.<br> 2025-451 - 1<br> See posts in the Special Specifications<br> Doc Title: Rental of portable extinguishers and the maintenance of fire extinguishers, fire terminals, disadvours and hydrants on the sites depending on the COCOF<br> C.... input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: MINISTRE DE LA DFENSE. Summary: Invitation to Submit an Application for Participation Regarding the Supply of 02 (Ea) Litter Pallets Fitted for A400m Atlas. Description: The present contract concerns the supply of 02 EA Litter Pallets fitted for A400M ATLAS. This purchase will provide a Pallet Based MEDEVAC capacity for transporting recumbent medium and low care patients in the cargo area of the Belgian/Luxembourg A400M fleet. The capacity envisaged is 12 patients with a maximum of 6 patients per Litter Pallet. Both Litter Pallets should be designed for modular use. The Litter Pallets must be designed and certified in accordance with the specific technical and logistic requirements. These requirements will be communicated, after the selection phase, in the second phase of this procurement procedure through the specifications. Only the selected candidates will receive the specifications and the opportunity to submit their tenders. <br> Doc Title: Invitation to submit an application for participation regarding the supply of 02 (EA) Litter Pallets fitted for A400M ATLAS <br> Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-07-14. Closing Date: 2025-08-11. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Invitation to Submit an Application for Participation Regarding the Supply of 02 (Ea) Litter Pallets Fitted for A400m Atlas

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: INNER SPF. Summary: Supply of Flexible Discharge Pipes, Including Half-Rascals, 8 "Diameters (203.2 Mm) and 10" (254 Mm) on Behalf of the Interior Spf. Description: Flexible discharge pipes are intended for operational units of civil protection. The discharge pipes are flattened, waterproof and provided at their two ends of symmetrical half-rascals to be able to connect them to each other, to pumps, parts of divisions and Monitors (cannons). In addition, they are used and stored in a container. This container has an automatic winding and course system to deploy these pipes. These discharge pipes are intended to replace those existing at the end of their life. Pressures required in these specifications are adapted to the maximum service pressures of the pumps used in the operational units of civil protection. In addition, there should be no decrease in quality compared to existing repression pipes.<br> MAP24-502-25-1<br> Doc Title: Supply of flexible discharge pipes, including half-rascals, 8 "diameters (203.2 mm) and 10" (254 mm) on behalf of the interior SPF<br> Type contract: supplies. Published Date: 2025-07-09. Closing Date: 2025-09-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH GOVERNMENT. Summary: Framework Agreement for Supplying Wooden Carriers and Wooden Posts for Information Boards. Description: The Agency for Nature and Forest manages more than 70,000 hectares of parks, forests and nature reserves in Flanders. In these domains, we want to conduct an active reception policy even more than before and welcome the visitor as a good host. An important element of the reception is to offer all Necessary information when visiting the domain. This information is offered compactly and comprehensively through information boards with maps, basic rules, basic information and photos. At various places in the domains, additional information can be provided with regard to management work, with regard to ecological phenomena (learning path signs). The current assignment includes the delivery of wooden constructions as a carrier for various types of information boards. Accessibility is also regulated by an accessibility scheme per area. This regulation is translated on the site via accessibility signs. They are applied to specific posts. The current assignment includes the delivery of wooden posts as a carrier for accessibility signs. Object of these deliveries: delivering wooden carriers for information boards and wooden posts. Description: This market relates to the purchase and delivery of 100 decontamination kits for Special Operations Medical Unit (SOMU). The SOMUs are vehicles with specialized medical teams of 3 people based on the model of the mobile emergency and resuscitation service (SMUR) of chemical risk Radionuclear biological (CBRNA) of the defense. This vehicle has complete CBRNE equipment and is deployed in a whole series of CBRNA and uncertain causes. During the reception of victims of an incident involving dangerous materials, such as a CBRNA incident (chemical, Biological, radiological, nuclear, explosive) or any other incident involving dangerous materials, it is crucial to minimize the risk of secondary contamination as soon as possible. Exposed people often wear contaminated clothes, which not only endangers their own Health, but also constitutes a threat to emergency workers, other patients and hospital infrastructure. To limit this risk, this supply procedure provides for the purchase of special kits which are distributed to exposed persons. These kits include Emergency clothes and ways to get rid of their contaminated clothes safely and discreetly, so that they can be prepared in a more in -depth medical assessment and decontamination in the hospital. Description: This market relates to the purchase and delivery of CBRNE individual protection equipment for didactic (and operational if necessary) for 7 universities and 5 special operations medical unit. The contracting authority chooses the negotiated procedure without prior publication. When welcomingVictims of an incident involving dangerous substances, such as an CBRNE (chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear, explosive) incident or any other incident involving dangerous substances, the protection of emergency stakeholders in the emergency service or in the intervention areais crucial. In the absence of adequate personal protective equipment (PPE), health care providers may be exposed to dangerous substances themselves, which not only endangers their own safety, but can also compromise the operation of the serviceemergencies and care for other patients. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AREA DEVELOPMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNING AND PROJECTS. Summary: How to Deal with Storage of Nitrate -containing Fertilizers in Flanders?. Description: Nitrate fertilizers are effective fertilizers that can be used widely in agriculture due to their high nitrogen content and rapid absorption by plants. However, the use, storage and transport of nitrate fertilizers requires careful handling and compliance with safety instructions, to minimize risks for both people and the environment. Most mineral inorganic fertilizers are not classified as dangerous. The intrinsic properties have an influence on the hazard aspects. The nitrate fertilizers marketed are therefore often classified as an oxidizing (fire -promoting) in accordance with CLP. Several large-scale accidents have already occurred in history (including Faversham-1916, Oppau-1921, Tessenderlo-1942, Texas City-1947). As a result, various measures were taken worldwide over time. For example, the risk of detonation is prevented by treating some forms of nitrate fertilizers in detonation resistant. In normal circumstances, the effects of detonation should not occur. However, relatively recently we are startled by large -scale incidents with these products in the world. Think Hie .... Published Date: 2025-06-05. Closing Date: 2025-08-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: AREA DEVELOPMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNING AND PROJECTS

Summary: Multilayer Leo Extended Gnss (Myle-Gnss) End-To-End Simulator Supporting Multi-Service Integrity Analysis. Description: Objective 1: to design and develop innovative solutions and algorithms that leverage the LEO infrastructure to enhance navigation and integrity performance across various safety-critical user domains (including aviation, automotive, UAV, etc.). Objective 2: to develop and deliver an end-to-end (E2E) software (SW) simulator that will allow to assess, for each MYLE-GNSS Scenario, the integrity performance of the target Services (ARAIM, SBAS, HAS, etc.) with respect to the target User Domain and related application. Objective 3: to conduct an extensive simulation testing campaign and a Proof-of-Concept (PoC) of the MYLE-GNSS implementation in order to validate navigation and integrity performance in support to the different services. <br> Doc Title: MultilaYer LEO Extended GNSS (MYLE-GNSS) end-to-end simulator supporting multi-service integrity analysis <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 700000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-06-02. Closing Date: 2025-07-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG DEFIS - DEFENCE INDUSTRY AND SPACE
output.Summary: Multilayer Leo Extended Gnss (Myle-Gnss) End-To-End Simulator Supporting Multi-Service Integrity Analysis
output.Description: Objective 1: to design and develop innovative solutions and algorithms that leverage the LEO infrastructure to enhance navigation and integrity performance across various safety-critical user domains (including aviation, automotive, UAV, etc.). Objective 2: to develop and deliver an end-to-end (E2E) software (SW) simulator that will allow to assess, for each MYLE-GNSS Scenario, the integrity performance of the target Services (ARAIM, SBAS, HAS, etc.) with respect to the target User Domain and related application. Objective 3: to conduct an extensive simulation testing campaign and a Proof-of-Concept (PoC) of the MYLE-GNSS implementation in order to validate navigation and integrity performance in support to the different services. <br> Doc Title: MultilaYer LEO Extended GNSS (MYLE-GNSS) end-to-end simulator supporting multi-service integrity analysis <br> Contract Type: services

Summary: Multilayer Leo Extended Gnss (Myle-Gnss) End-To-End Simulator Supporting Multi-Service Integrity Analysis. Objective 2: to develop and deliver an end-to-end (E2E) software (SW) simulator that will allow to assess, for each MYLE-GNSS Scenario, the integrity performance of the target Services (ARAIM, SBAS, HAS, etc.) with respect to the target User Domain and related application. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG CNECT - COMMUNICATIONS NETWORKS, CONTENT AND TECHNOLOGY. Summary: Study to Support the Evaluation and Review of Audiovisual Media Services Directive. Description: Article 33 AVMSD requires that by 19 December 2026 at the latest, the Commission shall submit to the European Parliament and the Council an ex-post evaluation of the impact of the Directive and its added value, accompanied where appropriate by proposals for its review. This study will be the basis for such ex-post evaluation and possible review of the Directive. Additionally, Article 13 and Article 16 AVMSD require the Commission to report, based on the information provided by Member States and on an independent study, on the application of the AVMSD provisions concerning the promotion of European works,including independent productions in television programmes and on-demand services. The study will have five specific objectives: 1.) Provide the Commission with information and data about the application of the Directive, in particular in the aforementioned areas, in light of the developments of the EU audiovisual market, notably its increasing digitalisation; 2.) Provide the Commission with an objective quantitative and qualitative assessment of the Directive-s implementation, looking particularly at the most significant issues; 3.) With regard to Articles 13, 16 and 17, provide the Commission with information and data required for the monitoring of and reporting on the implementation of the AVMSD rules for the promotion of European works, including independent productions; 4.) Identify, where justified by the above assessment, possible regulatory updates / amendments to the.... Tender Value: 700000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-04-30. Closing Date: 2025-05-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG DEFIS - DEFENCE INDUSTRY AND SPACE. Summary: Multilayer Leo Extended Gnss (Myle-Gnss) End-To-End Simulator Supporting Multi-Service Integrity Analysis. Description: Objective 1: to design and develop innovative solutions and algorithms that leverage the LEO infrastructure to enhance navigation and integrity performance across various safety-critical user domains (including aviation, automotive, UAV, etc.). Objective 2: to develop and deliver an end-to-end (E2E) software (SW) simulator that will allow to assess, for each MYLE-GNSS Scenario, the integrity performance of the target Services (ARAIM, SBAS, HAS, etc.) with respect to the target User Domain and related application. Objective 3: to conduct an extensive simulation testing campaign and a Proof-of-Concept (PoC) of the MYLE-GNSS implementation in order to validate navigation and integrity performance in support to the different services. <br> Doc Title: MultilaYer LEO Extended GNSS (MYLE-GNSS) end-to-end simulator supporting multi-service integrity analysis <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENT OF QUALITY AND ANIMAL WELFARE. Summary: Evaluation of the Development Plan for Organic Production in Wallonia by 2030. Description: The declaration of Walloon regional policy 2024-2029 stipulates that the government "will assess the organic plan independently and, if necessary, may adapt it"; With the Walloon government's commitment to "continue, in any case, to firmly support the organic sector with a strategyfocused on demand, supply and innovation. " The plan concerned is the "development plan for biological production in Wallonia by 2030" (or "organic plan 2030"), adopted on June 3, 2021, under the previous legislature. This plan includes a strategic part, which notably setsAmbitious development objectives for the organic sector in Wallonia by 2030, as well as an operational part, which consists of an action plan for the period 2021-2025. This market aims to entrust the expected assessment to an external service provider. The services to be executed,Detailed in part 2 of this specifications, consist in carrying out a systemic analysis of the development of organic production in Wallonia, in assessing the current organic 2030 plan (strategic and operational parts) and in formulating recommendations and proposals for sharesFor a next action plan covering the period 2026-2030. <br> Type: Services <br> Supporting Services for the Government (75130000). output.Purchaser_Name: DEPARTMENT OF QUALITY AND ANIMAL WELFARE
output.Summary: Evaluation of the Development Plan for Organic Production in Wallonia by 2030
output.Description: The declaration of Walloon regional policy 2024-2029 stipulates that the government "will assess the organic plan independently and, if necessary, may adapt it"; With the Walloon government's commitment to "continue, in any case, to firmly support the organic sector with a strategyfocused on demand, supply and innovation. " The plan concerned is the "development plan for biological production in Wallonia by 2030" (or "organic plan 2030"), adopted on June 3, 2021, under the previous legislature. This plan includes a strategic part, which notably setsAmbitious development objectives for the organic sector in Wallonia by 2030, as well as an operational part, which consists of an action plan for the period 2021-2025. This market aims to entrust the expected assessment to an external service provider. The services to be executed,Detailed in part 2 of this specifications, consist in carrying out a systemic analysis of the development of organic production in Wallonia, in assessing the current organic 2030 plan (strategic and operational parts) and in formulating recommendations and proposals for sharesFor a next action plan covering the period 2026-2030. <br> Type: Services <br> Supporting Services for the Government (75130000)
output.Sub_Sector: Administration, Defence and Social Security

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG CNECT - COMMUNICATIONS NETWORKS, CONTENT AND TECHNOLOGY. Summary: Study to Support the Evaluation and Review of Audiovisual Media Services Directive. Description: Article 33 AVMSD requires that by 19 December 2026 at the latest, the Commission shall submit to the European Parliament and the Council an ex-post evaluation of the impact of the Directive and its added value, accompanied where appropriate by proposals for its review. This study will be the basis for such ex-post evaluation and possible review of the Directive. Additionally, Article 13 and Article 16 AVMSD require the Commission to report, based on the information provided by Member States and on an independent study, on the application of the AVMSD provisions concerning the promotion of European works,including independent productions in television programmes and on-demand services. The study will have five specific objectives: 1.) Provide the Commission with information and data about the application of the Directive, in particular in the aforementioned areas, in light of the developments of the EU audiovisual market, notably its increasing digitalisation; 2.) Provide the Commission with an objective quantitative and qualitative assessment of the Directive-s implementation, looking particularly at the most significant issues; 3.) With regard to Articles 13, 16 and 17, provide the Commission with information and data required for the monitoring of and reporting on the implementation of the AVMSD rules for the promotion of European works, including independent productions; 4.) Identify, where justified by the above assessment, possible regulatory updates / amendments to the.... Tender Value: 700000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-03-28. Closing Date: 2025-05-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG EMPL - EMPLOYMENT, SOCIAL AFFAIRS AND INCLUSION. Summary: Assistance to the Secretariat of the Audit Board of the Administrative Commission for the Coordination of Social Security Systems. Description: The European Commission holds the secretariat of the Audit Board of the Administrative Commission for the coordination of social security systems. The Administrative Commission is responsible for questions of interpretation arising from the provisions of regulations on social security coordination, and for promoting and developing collaboration between EU countries. The Audit Board is attached to the Administrative Commission and monitors the reimbursements of healthcare costs between Member States and reports to the Administrative Commission. The purpose of the Contract is to ensure the services of a technical expertise to the Secretariat of the Audit Board in order to enable the Audit Board to carry out its task as set out in Article 74 of Regulation (EC) No 883/2004 and in Articles 62 to 69 and 86 of Regulation (EC) No 987/2009. <br> Doc Title: Assistance to the Secretariat of the Audit Board of the Administrative Commission for the coordination of social security systems <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 400000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-03-06. Closing Date: 2025-04-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG EMPL - EMPLOYMENT, SOCIAL AFFAIRS AND INCLUSION
output.Summary: Assistance to the Secretariat of the Audit Board of the Administrative Commission for the Coordination of Social Security Systems
output.Description: The European Commission holds the secretariat of the Audit Board of the Administrative Commission for the coordination of social security systems. The Administrative Commission is responsible for questions of interpretation arising from the provisions of regulations on social security coordination, and for promoting and developing collaboration between EU countries. The Audit Board is attached to the Administrative Commission and monitors the reimbursements of healthcare costs between Member States and reports to the Administrative Commission. The purpose of the Contract is to ensure the services of a technical expertise to the Secretariat of the Audit Board in order to enable the Audit Board to carry out its task as set out in Article 74 of Regulation (EC) No 883/2004 and in Articles 62 to 69 and 86 of Regulation (EC) No 987/2009. <br> Doc Title: Assistance to the Secretariat of the Audit Board of the Administrative Commission for the coordination of social security systems <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG EMPL - EMPLOYMENT, SOCIAL AFFAIRS AND INCLUSION. Summary: Assistance to the Secretariat of the Audit Board of the Administrative Commission for the Coordination of Social Security Systems. Description: The European Commission holds the secretariat of the Audit Board of the Administrative Commission for the coordination of social security systems. The Administrative Commission is responsible for questions of interpretation arising from the provisions of regulations on social security coordination, and for promoting and developing collaboration between EU countries. The Audit Board is attached to the Administrative Commission and monitors the reimbursements of healthcare costs between Member States and reports to the Administrative Commission. The purpose of the Contract is to ensure the services of a technical expertise to the Secretariat of the Audit Board in order to enable the Audit Board to carry out its task as set out in Article 74 of Regulation (EC) No 883/2004 and in Articles 62 to 69 and 86 of Regulation (EC) No 987/2009. <br> Doc Title: Assistance to the Secretariat of the Audit Board of the Administrative Commission for the coordination of social security systems <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-02-07. Closing Date: 2025-03-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AREA DEVELOPMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNING AND PROJECTS. Summary: How to Deal with Storage of Nitrate -containing Fertilizers in Flanders?. Description: This assignment is part of the following general objective of the Environmental Effects team, as included in our draft memorandum External Safety. Here specifically in the context of the Environmental Safety Knowledge Network. Although nitrate fertilizers have been treated as detonation -resistant, these recent incidents show that large -scale explosions still prevent. This investigation wants to find out which circumstances lead to such large -scale incidents, which safety measures must be taken, which of these safety measures have already been described in regulations and best practices, and which safety measures may be missing. In order to be able to answer these questions, it is important to know which forms or variants of nitrate fertilizers can be present in Flanders and how these products are stored and transported. Other questions ask themselves are, among other things: are the same measures applied in the context of transit of these nitrate fertilizers as with products that are marketed in the EU? input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN DEFENCE AGENCY. Summary: Service Framework Contract for the Provision of a Proof of Concept on Integration of Ai in M&S Enabled Wargaming (24.Rti.Op.202). Description: The domain selected for the 2024 Proof-of-Concept under HEDI is the Digital domain with a specific focus the exploration of the role of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in modelling and simulation (M&S) enabled wargaming (WG). M&S-enabled WG provides significant advantages to military end-users by creating realistic and controlled environments in which to test and refine strategies without the risks and costs associated with live training exercises. Additionally, wargaming facilitates the evaluation of new tactics and technologies, enabling military operators to adapt to evolving warfare landscapes swiftly. The ability to replicate diverse combat situations and iterate through multiple scenarios ensures that personnel are well-versed in handling a wide range of contingencies, ultimately leading to improved mission success rates and reduced casualties. The integration of AI into M&S-enabled WG could bring transformative benefits. AI enhances the realism and complexity of simulated environments by generating dynamic and adaptive threat scenarios that evolve based on the actions of the participants. This capability ensures that military operators face unpredictable and challenging situations, closely mimicking real-world conditions. AI-driven simulations can analyse vast amounts of data in real-time, providing immediate feedback and strategic recommendations, which significantly enhances the learning experience. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG HOME - MIGRATION AND HOME AFFAIRS. Summary: Technical and Logistical Support to the Activities of the European Migration Network (Emn). Description: The subject of this procurement procedure is the technical and logistical support to the activities of the European Migration Network (EMN). The EMN was established in 2008 and is an EU Member States network of migration and asylum experts who work together to provide objective, comparable policy-relevant information and knowledge on emerging issues relating to asylum and migration in Europe. The EMN also provides a secure platform where various clusters of practitioners or policymakers exchange information and work together, and hosts a series of operational tools which facilitate Member States work on all aspects of migration and asylum across the EU, including return and integration assistance, statelessness, information and awareness raising campaigns, etc. <br> Doc Title: Technical and logistical support to the activities of the European Migration Network (EMN) <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EISMEA), EISMEA - EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Erasmus for Young Entrepreneurs - Support Office. Description: The purpose of this contract is to select a programme Support Office that will coordinate and support the activities of the Intermediary Organisations (IOs) of the Erasmus for Young Entrepreneurs programme. The Erasmus for Young Entrepreneurs programme is implemented by a network of local contact points (Intermediary Organisations - IOs), which are selected on the basis of a separate call for proposals. The IOs are in charge of recruiting and matching the entrepreneurs and facilitating the mobility actions. They also promote the programme and its benefits at local and national level. The coordination of the IOs' network, the day-to-day support as well as promotion of the EYE programme is ensured by the Support Office. In addition, the Support Office is in charge of central communication activities, including social media presence, public website and organisation of/participation at events at European level. Any private or public entity active in the field of business support, consulting, public affairs and public relations and with experience and knowledge on EU affairs can participate in this call for tenders. If the handover phase is applicable, the contract for the Support Office will run for 39 months starting as of 01 February 2025, if both parties have already signed it. Otherwise, it will enter into force on the date on which the last party signs it. If the handover phase is not applicable, the contract for the Support Office will run for 36 months starting as of 01 .... Tender Value: 1800000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-07-31. Closing Date: 2024-09-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EISMEA), EISMEA - EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY

The IOs are in charge of recruiting and matching the entrepreneurs and facilitating the mobility actions. They also promote the programme and its benefits at local and national level. The coordination of the IOs' network, the day-to-day support as well as promotion of the EYE programme is ensured by the Support Office. In addition, the Support Office is in charge of central communication activities, including social media presence, public website and organisation of/participation at events at European level. Any private or public entity active in the field of business support, consulting, public affairs and public relations and with experience and knowledge on EU affairs can participate in this call for tenders. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN DEFENCE AGENCY. Summary: Lot 7 (Eda Ref. N 24.Rti.Ot.272): Opex Support Team. Description: EDA intends to award a single Framework Contract (FWC) to a service provider to support EDA and EU MSs in the design, execution and evaluation of a military operational experimentation campaign. The specific objectives of this FWC comprise the delivery of the following elements: Develop a methodology to assess the capability maturity of products/prototypes. Develop an experimental design that clearly articulates the objectives, hypotheses, and methodologies, in close cooperation with EDA and MS representatives. Support in the planning and execution of the experimental campaign in close cooperation with EDA, the Host Member State and the industries involved. Collected data during the experimentation, analyse them and assess the experimental observations to derive reliable, actionable insights on the DOTMLPFI implications of future integration in capabilities of the products that participated in the OPEX. Support EDA and the Host Member State in the organization of a VIP demonstration day to showcase the experimental outcomes to high-ranked stakeholders. <br> Doc Title: LOT 7 (EDA ref. N 24.RTI.OT.272): OPEX Support team <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 700000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-07-16. Closing Date: 2024-09-20. Competition: ICB. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG HOME - MIGRATION AND HOME AFFAIRS. Summary: Technical and Logistical Support to the Activities of the European Migration Network (Emn). Description: The subject of this procurement procedure is the technical and logistical support to the activities of the European Migration Network (EMN). The EMN is an EU network of migration and asylum experts who work together to provide objective, comparable policy-relevant information and knowledge on emerging issues relating to asylum and migration in Europe. The EMN also provides a secure platform where various clusters of practitioners or policy makers exchange information and work together and hosts a series of operational tools which facilitate Member States work on all aspects of migration across the EU including: Return and Integration Assistance, Statelessness, Information and Awareness Raising Campaigns, Solidarity Platform Mechanism, etc. <br> Doc Title: Technical and logistical support to the activities of the European Migration Network (EMN) <br> Contract Type: services. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, FPI - SERVICE FOR FOREIGN POLICY INSTRUMENTS. Summary: Framework Contract (3 Lots) for the Procurement of Medical Facilities And/Or Equipment, Vehicles and Individual Equipment for Partner Armed Forces Supported by the European Peace Facility. Description: The European Peace Facility (EPF) established by Council Decision (CFSP) 2021/509 finances assistance measures in support of partner military forces of beneficiary Third States, Regional or International organisations. The European Commission, Service for Foreign Policy Instruments (FPI), acting as the Administrator for assistance measures, is exploring the possibility to launch, in the course of 2024, a call for tenders for the conclusion of framework contracts in order to procure non-lethal equipment pertaining to the following three broad categories: Medical facilities and/or equipment ; vehicles ; and individual equipment for soldiers. Procurement under these contracts may include delivery at the beneficiaries- location as well as training and maintenance services. The overall procurement shall be financed by the EPF, as regulated by Council Decision (CFSP)2021/509 and the EPF Implementing Rules (doc. ST 15767/22). Prior to the launch of a call for tenders, FPI is conducting a preliminary market analysis, in order to achieve better understanding of the market regarding the three broad categories of equipment referred above. To this effect, FPI invites market operators / commercial companies / wholesalers to manifest their interest for being consulted by sending their company profile via email to FPI-EPF-FWC@ec.europa.eu. <br> Doc Title: Framework Contract (3 LOTS) for the procurement of medical facilities and/or equipment, vehicles and individual equipment .... Tender Value: 130000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-06-14. Closing Date: 2025-06-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, FPI - SERVICE FOR FOREIGN POLICY INSTRUMENTS

The European Commission, Service for Foreign Policy Instruments (FPI), acting as the Administrator for assistance measures, is exploring the possibility to launch, in the course of 2024, a call for tenders for the conclusion of framework contracts in order to procure non-lethal equipment pertaining to the following three broad categories: Medical facilities and/or equipment ; vehicles ; and individual equipment for soldiers. Procurement under these contracts may include delivery at the beneficiaries- location as well as training and maintenance services. The overall procurement shall be financed by the EPF, as regulated by Council Decision (CFSP)2021/509 and the EPF Implementing Rules (doc. ST 15767/22). Prior to the launch of a call for tenders, FPI is conducting a preliminary market analysis, in order to achieve better understanding of the market regarding the three broad categories of equipment referred above. To this effect, FPI invites market operators / commercial companies / wholesalers to manifest their interest for being consulted by sending their company profile via email to FPI-EPF-FWC@ec.europa.eu. <br> Doc Title: Framework Contract (3 LOTS) for the procurement of medical facilities and/or equipment, vehicles and individual equipment ...

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, FPI - SERVICE FOR FOREIGN POLICY INSTRUMENTS. Summary: Framework Contract (3 Lots) for the Procurement of Medical Facilities And/Or Equipment, Vehicles and Individual Equipment for Partner Armed Forces Supported by the European Peace Facility. Description: The European Peace Facility (EPF) established by Council Decision (CFSP) 2021/509 finances assistance measures in support of partner military forces of beneficiary Third States, Regional or International organisations. The European Commission, Service for Foreign Policy Instruments (FPI), acting as the Administrator for assistance measures, is exploring the possibility to launch, in the course of 2024, a call for tenders for the conclusion of framework contracts in order to procure non-lethal equipment pertaining to the following three broad categories: Medical facilities and/or equipment ; vehicles ; and individual equipment for soldiers. Procurement under these contracts may include delivery at the beneficiaries- location as well as training and maintenance services. The overall procurement shall be financed by the EPF, as regulated by Council Decision (CFSP)2021/509 and the EPF Implementing Rules (doc. ST 15767/22). Prior to the launch of a call for tenders, FPI is conducting a preliminary market analysis, in order to achieve better understanding of the market regarding the three broad categories of equipment referred above. To this effect, FPI invites market operators / commercial companies / wholesalers to manifest their interest for being consulted by sending their company profile via email to FPI-EPF-FWC@ec.europa.eu, no later than 15 June 2024. <br> Doc Title: Framework Contract (3 LOTS) for the procurement of medical facilities and/or equipment, vehicle.... Tender Value: 130000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-05-27. Closing Date: 2025-05-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, FPI - SERVICE FOR FOREIGN POLICY INSTRUMENTS

Procurement under these contracts may include delivery at the beneficiaries- location as well as training and maintenance services. The overall procurement shall be financed by the EPF, as regulated by Council Decision (CFSP)2021/509 and the EPF Implementing Rules (doc. ST 15767/22). Prior to the launch of a call for tenders, FPI is conducting a preliminary market analysis, in order to achieve better understanding of the market regarding the three broad categories of equipment referred above. Description: In the context of the cluster of Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) related projects that aim at providing the sought UAS Enablers for Safe Airspace Integration in European Skyes, the European Defence Agency (EDA) intends to launch a tender with four lots to support the progress of safe airspace integration of UAS, from low level to high altitude operations (HAO). -------- As part of the forthcoming tender, EDA is organising an information session 04 July 2024, to be held virtually, via WebEx (see below additional information). -------- Lot 1: UAS Single European Sky Experimental Integration: In a drive to elevate the capabilities of European-made low-cost tactical UAS for precision navigation, the new project focuses on two key objectives. Firstly, it seeks to enhance their operational resilience in challenging environments for safe airspace integration - specifically those with limited or denied GNSS access and potential electronic jamming threats. Secondly, the project will leverage recent breakthroughs in EU space-based services alongside onboard sensor fusion powered by artificial intelligence. This integration aims to achieve unwavering navigation accuracy regardless of spectrum availability, demonstrably validating its effectiveness through real-world proof-of-concept and demonstration phases. The successful development of these advanced navigation capabilities for UAS aims to ensure their safe integration into the airspace. --------Lot 2: Risk Assessment for UAS operat.... Tender Value: 2900000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-05-17. Closing Date: 2025-05-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Defence Agency (EDA)

Firstly, it seeks to enhance their operational resilience in challenging environments for safe airspace integration - specifically those with limited or denied GNSS access and potential electronic jamming threats. Secondly, the project will leverage recent breakthroughs in EU space-based services alongside onboard sensor fusion powered by artificial intelligence. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, FPI - SERVICE FOR FOREIGN POLICY INSTRUMENTS. Summary: Framework Contract (3 Lots) for the Procurement of Medical Facilities And/Or Equipment, Vehicles and Individual Equipment for Partner Armed Forces Supported by the European Peace Facility. Description: The European Peace Facility (EPF) established by Council Decision (CFSP) 2021/509 finances assistance measures in support of partner military forces of beneficiary Third States, Regional or International organisations. The European Commission, Service for Foreign Policy Instruments (FPI), acting as the Administrator for assistance measures, is exploring the possibility to launch, in the course of 2024, a call for tenders for the conclusion of framework contracts in order to procure non-lethal equipment pertaining to the following three broad categories: Medical facilities and/or equipment ; vehicles ; and individual equipment for soldiers. Procurement under these contracts may include delivery at the beneficiaries- location as well as training and maintenance services. The overall procurement shall be financed by the EPF, as regulated by Council Decision (CFSP)2021/509 and the EPF Implementing Rules (doc. ST 15767/22). Prior to the launch of a call for tenders, FPI is conducting a preliminary market analysis, in order to achieve better understanding of the market regarding the three broad categories of equipment referred above. To this effect, FPI invites market operators / commercial companies / wholesalers to manifest their interest for being consulted by sending their company profile via email to FPI-EPF-FWC@ec.europa.eu, no later than 15 June 2024. <br> Doc Title: Framework Contract (3 LOTS) for the procurement of medical facilities and/or equipment, vehicle.... Published Date: 2024-05-08. Closing Date: 2025-05-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

Summary: Programme for Peer Reviews in the Framework of Eu Cooperation on Civil Protection and Disaster Risk Management. Description: The EU Peer Review programme promotes an integrated approach to disaster risk management and supports a wider policy dialogue across Europe and beyond, improving policy coherence and facilitating the exchange of good practices on civil protection and disaster risk management. The programme is a tool made available to civil protection authorities of Member States, participating states, enlargement and neighbourhood countries under the EU Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) legislation. It is managed by the Commission's Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid department (DG ECHO). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL AGENCY FOR RADIOACTIVE WASTE AND ENRICHED FISSILE MATERIALS. Summary: Fire Safety Storage Building 127X. Description: The subject of the assignment is: "PM0371 - Fire Safety 127X". The existing storage building 127X contains four bunkers in which medium-level radioactive waste is stored in conditioned form. In bunkers 1, 2 and 3 there are approximately 13,500 bituminized Eurobitumen packages, which areThe chemical composition entails specific fire risks. To meet the fire safety requirements set in art. 17 of the Royal Decree of 30 November 2011 on safety regulations for nuclear installations (as amended by the Royal Decree of 19 December2014) a fire fighting plan must be developed, whereby the spread of a possible fire must be limited. The firefighting strategy consists of quickly flooding all existing packages in one bunker, immediately after detecting a fire of one Euro.bitumen package in this bunker. To achieve this, an automated extinguishing system was designed that has the following functionalities: - reliable detection of a fire from a Eurobitumen package in a bunker; - gravity filling of the relevant bunker with water, within the hallf hours, up to a level above the top layer of packages (approximately 4 meters); - cooling and precipitating smoke in the communal corridor adjacent to the bunkers. There is also the need for smooth and safe access and a professional welcome.For security services, this file applies to all non-grid-connected buildings (campuses, regional offices, customer offices and collection points, including DC Lokeren). For reception services, this applies to some campuses, currently Melle and Mechelen. Depending on the needs of Fluvius, these services can also be requested for events or possibly expanded to other Fluvius locations in the future. This involves carrying out the following tasks:  For 24/24 security: o static surveillance (permanent surveillance at the technical desk) with anexpand range of tasks such as printers, winter service, etc.; o security agents on site; o preventive mobile surveillance (man surveillance for interventions after alarm); o patrol services; (similar to above); o ad hoc calling of security officers based on necessity (e.g. at events, entranceg / exit control, threat situations,..); o temporary hardware and software where a link with a control room is required and which cannot be immediately realized via the Fluvius control room. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EISMEA), EISMEA - EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Support Facility for Interregional Innovation Investments (I3) (I3 Support Facility). Description: The I3 support facility will assist and support innovation actors in less developed regions in building stronger administrative structures and processes supporting local ecosystem capacities for interregional cooperation, strengthening links and structures among the quadruple helix stakeholders. This horizontal support facility will be set up to assist quadruple helix stakeholders with technical and regulatory issues, as well as provide implementation and monitoring advice on projects in joint innovation areas. This facility will also support and manage the networking and exchange of best practices for organising and promoting cooperation and links between national and regional quadruple helix stakeholders with the aim of establishing lasting cooperation structures and/or methods among innovation system stakeholders. With a view to stimulating innovation and in turn opportunities for high skills jobs, the situation of regions facing difficulties in retaining and attracting talent will be duly taken into account. <br> Doc Title: Support facility for Interregional Innovation Investments (I3) (I3 support facility) <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 3136062. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-02-05. Closing Date: 2024-02-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EISMEA), EISMEA - EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY

This horizontal support facility will be set up to assist quadruple helix stakeholders with technical and regulatory issues, as well as provide implementation and monitoring advice on projects in joint innovation areas. This facility will also support and manage the networking and exchange of best practices for organising and promoting cooperation and links between national and regional quadruple helix stakeholders with the aim of establishing lasting cooperation structures and/or methods among innovation system stakeholders. With a view to stimulating innovation and in turn opportunities for high skills jobs, the situation of regions facing difficulties in retaining and attracting talent will be duly taken into account. <br> Doc Title: Support facility for Interregional Innovation Investments (I3) (I3 support facility) <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLUVIUS SYSTEM OPERATOR CV (SPECIAL SECTOR). Summary: Security and Reception. Description: The purpose of this file is to award a contract for the provision of security and reception services to protect the Fluvius buildings and grounds 24/7 against fire, burglary and unauthorized access. There is also the need for smooth and safe access and a professional welcome.For security services, this file applies to all non-grid-connected buildings (campuses, regional offices, customer offices and collection points, including DC Lokeren). For reception services, this applies to some campuses, currently Melle and Mechelen. Depending on the needs of Fluvius, these services can also be requested for events or possibly expanded to other Fluvius locations in the future. This involves carrying out the following tasks:  For 24/24 security: o static surveillance (permanent surveillance at the technical desk) with anexpand range of tasks such as printers, winter service, etc.; o security agents on site; o preventive mobile surveillance (man surveillance for interventions after alarm); o patrol services; (similar to above); o ad hoc calling of security officers based on necessity (e.g. at events, entranceg / exit control, threat situations,..); o temporary hardware and software where a link with a control room is required and which cannot be immediately realized via the Fluvius control room.  For reception: o reception/reception services (reception staff) with an extensive range of tasks including.... Tender Value: 17736075.57. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-01-19. Closing Date: 2024-02-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL AGENCY FOR RADIOACTIVE WASTE AND ENRICHED FISSILE MATERIALS. Summary: Fire Safety Storage Building 127X. Description: The subject of the assignment is: "PM0371 - Fire Safety 127X". The existing storage building 127X contains four bunkers in which medium-level radioactive waste is stored in conditioned form. In bunkers 1, 2 and 3 there are approximately 13,500 bituminized Eurobitumen packages, which areThe chemical composition entails specific fire risks. To meet the fire safety requirements set in art. 17 of the Royal Decree of 30 November 2011 on safety regulations for nuclear installations (as amended by the Royal Decree of 19 December2014) a fire fighting plan must be developed, whereby the spread of a possible fire must be limited. The firefighting strategy consists of quickly flooding all existing packages in one bunker, immediately after detecting a fire of one Euro.bitumen package in this bunker. To achieve this, an automated extinguishing system was designed that has the following functionalities: - reliable detection of a fire from a Eurobitumen package in a bunker; - gravity filling of the relevant bunker with water, within the hallf hours, up to a level above the top layer of packages (approximately 4 meters); - cooling and precipitating smoke in the communal corridor adjacent to the bunkers. The necessary installations will be placed on the northeast side of building 127X. These installations consist of three concrete.... Published Date: 2024-01-05. Closing Date: 2024-03-01. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: ECOWERF, INTERMUNICIPAL ENVIRONMENTAL COMPANY IN EAST BRABANT. Summary: Framework Agreement for the Supply of Bags and Ppe Sets for Asbestos Collection. Description: EcoWerf wishes to conclude a framework agreement for three years for the supply of bags for asbestos collection at home and collection at recycling parks, and also for PPE sets for asbestos collection at home. In the specifications and upon delivery, a distinction is made between sheet bags and cubic bagsen.<br> EcoWerf-2023-AM-304 - 1 - Delivery of bags for asbestos collection at home, and collection at recycling parks<br> EcoWerf collects (bonded) bound asbestos at its recycling parks, such as corrugated sheets, floor tiles and asbestos slates. Corrugated sheets containing asbestos are collected in sheet bags with closing ribbons; and asbestos slates, floor tiles, etc. are collected in cubic bags with a zipper. <br> EcoWerf also offers citizens who undertake asbestos removal on their own, bags for the safe removal and packaging of asbestos-containing corrugated sheets and slates. The asbestos-containing corrugated sheetsare packed by the citizens in zippered sheet bags, which guarantees easy use by the citizens. Asbestos slates are packed in cubic bags with an inner bag and closing ribbon.<br> EcoWerf-2023-AM-304 - 2 - Delivery of PPE sets for asbestos collection at home<br> EcoWerf offers citizens living in ecarry out asbestos removal under our own management, provide personal protective equipment for the safe removal and packaging of asbestos-containing corrugated sheets and slates. <br> Doc Title: Framework agreement for the supply of bags and PPE sets for asbestos collection <br> Contract Type: supplies. Corrugated sheets containing asbestos are collected in sheet bags with closing ribbons; and asbestos slates, floor tiles, etc. are collected in cubic bags with a zipper. <br> EcoWerf also offers citizens who undertake asbestos removal on their own, bags for the safe removal and packaging of asbestos-containing corrugated sheets and slates. The asbestos-containing corrugated sheetsare packed by the citizens in zippered sheet bags, which guarantees easy use by the citizens. Asbestos slates are packed in cubic bags with an inner bag and closing ribbon.<br> EcoWerf-2023-AM-304 - 2 - Delivery of PPE sets for asbestos collection at home<br> EcoWerf offers citizens living in ecarry out asbestos removal under our own management, provide personal protective equipment for the safe removal and packaging of asbestos-containing corrugated sheets and slates. <br> Doc Title: Framework agreement for the supply of bags and PPE sets for asbestos collection <br> Contract Type: supplies
output.Sub_Sector: Security, Fire Fighting, Police and Defence

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Counter Uas Solutions. Description: Counter UAS equipment for research and protection of Commission infrastructure The application of Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS), commonly referred to as drones, is increasing rapidly used for services in agriculture, transport, survey, surveillance etc. However, there is potential for misuse of UAS: they can be used to breach privacy, for espionage by using cameras or other sensors, to hijack telecommunication signals and in combination with biological or chemicals agents, explosives or other weapons they could harm persons, disrupt services and damage infrastructure. The contracting authority will use this FWC to setup a C-UAS living lab for Critical Infrastructure stakeholders and for a better UAS protection of European Commission and European Institution buildings. This tender covers C-UAS solution services for both the Berlaymont and Charlemagne buildings in the European quarter in Brussels. <br> Doc Title: Counter UAS solutions <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 4500000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-01-02. Closing Date: 2023-09-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EISMEA), EISMEA - EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Support Facility for Interregional Innovation Investments (I3) (I3 Support Facility). Description: The I3 support facility will assist and support innovation actors in less developed regions in building stronger administrative structures and processes supporting local ecosystem capacities for interregional cooperation, strengthening links and structures among the quadruple helix stakeholders. This horizontal support facility will be set up to assist quadruple helix stakeholders with technical and regulatory issues, as well as provide implementation and monitoring advice on projects in joint innovation areas. This facility will also support and manage the networking and exchange of best practices for organising and promoting cooperation and links between national and regional quadruple helix stakeholders with the aim of establishing lasting cooperation structures and/or methods among innovation system stakeholders. With a view to stimulating innovation and in turn opportunities for high skills jobs, the situation of regions facing difficulties in retaining and attracting talent will be duly taken into account. <br> Doc Title: Support facility for Interregional Innovation Investments (I3) (I3 support facility) <br> Contract Type: services. With a view to stimulating innovation and in turn opportunities for high skills jobs, the situation of regions facing difficulties in retaining and attracting talent will be duly taken into account. <br> Doc Title: Support facility for Interregional Innovation Investments (I3) (I3 support facility) <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BRUSSELS AIRPORT COMPANY NV. Summary: Access to the Future. Description: The aim of the Access to the Future (ACFU) project is an end-to-end renewal of the physical access control solution at Brussels Airport. <br> It consists of two lots: <br> Lot 1: Replacement of the existing Cotag badges, including a taylor -made badge architecture according to BAC requirements.This lot also includes the management software and printers that enable BAC to print and configure the badges. <br> Lot 2: Replacement of the existing hardware (controllers and readers) including: management and visualization software, programmed applications, and interfaces with PLCs, external systememen and software packages. Also included within the scope of this lot, a framework contract for future expansions and a maintenance contract for the access control installation at BAC. The scope of the maintenance contract is broader than the components in the scope of the replacement project. Existingcomponents, systems and techniques that directly interface with the access control system are also part of the scope of the maintenance contract, e.g. locks, door motors, buttons, perimeter detection systems, access gates, one-way axes, PNG gates, control PLCs, CCTV equipment,Digifort VMS, <br> BAC/2020/067 - 1<br> BAC/2020/067 - 2<br> Doc Title: Access to the future<br> Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2023-11-19. Closing Date: 2024-10-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BRUSSELS AIRPORT COMPANY NV. Summary: Access to the Future. Description: The aim of the Access to the Future (ACFU) project is an end-to-end renewal of the physical access control solution at Brussels Airport. <br> It consists of two lots: <br> Lot 1: Replacement of the existing Cotag badges, including a taylor -made badge architecture according to BAC requirements.This lot also includes the management software and printers that enable BAC to print and configure the badges. <br> Lot 2: Replacement of the existing hardware (controllers and readers) including: management and visualization software, programmed applications, and interfaces with PLCs, external systememen and software packages. Also included within the scope of this lot, a framework contract for future expansions and a maintenance contract for the access control installation at BAC. The scope of the maintenance contract is broader than the components in the scope of the replacement project. Existingcomponents, systems and techniques that directly interface with the access control system are also part of the scope of the maintenance contract, e.g. locks, door motors, buttons, perimeter detection systems, access gates, one-way axes, PNG gates, control PLCs, CCTV equipment,Digifort VMS, <br> BAC/2020/067 - 1<br> BAC/2020/067 - 2<br> Doc Title: Access to the future<br> Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2023-11-18. Closing Date: 2024-11-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Access to the Future

This is part of the planrecovery of the Walloon Region, projects 252c and 253. <br> This approach is part of a multidisciplinary approach serving the beneficiary. Indeed, digital assistance strengthens the teams of occupational therapists, home care and helpers and social workers, all supported bytechnicians from the partners referred to in point I.6.<br> The aim being to secure the person by analyzing lifestyle habits in their environment, to detect dangers as well as abnormal situations and to raise the alert.<br> Purpose and nature of the contract <br> For each lot, the purpose of this contract isthe supply of intelligent televigilance devices (digital assistance) as well as the acquisition of licenses relating to.<br> The market is divided into three lots as follows:<br> Lot 1: Digital assistance devices and accessories<br> Lot 2: Detectors fall and digital assistance box<br> Lot 3: Appdevices and digital assistance accessories with image sensors (fall detection) <br> The candidate can submit an application for one, two or all 3 lots. <br> This market is supported by the Walloon Region, Aviq and the European Union.<br> In accordance with article 42 1, 2 of the law of June 17, 2.... input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN DEFENCE AGENCY (EDA). Summary: Service Framework Contract for the Provision of Data Centric Security and Zero Trust Architecture Technologies (Darc)-. Description: DARC pursues the general objective of EDA pMS in identifying the technology challenges but also non-technology ones but with an impact on technology, towards the implementation of DCS and ZTA, especially in hybrid environments of both locally hosted and cloud-based infrastructure. The focus of this general objective must be the application of DCS and ZTA in military environments and the provision of relevant use cases. The analysis, findings and results shall provide tangible solutions and actionable recommendations for near-term adoption when possible and propose specific roadmap for mid-term adoption in cases that near-term is not feasible. Especially in the Defence and under the context of Multi-Domain Operations (MDO) and associated Command and Control (C2) systems, sharing of data through various means between the involved armed forces in a secure and controlled way for the appropriate required period, is crucial for mission success. <br> Doc Title: Service Framework Contract for the Provision of Data Centric Security and Zero Trust Architecture Technologies (DARC)- <br> Contract Type: Services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN UNION, REPRESENTED BY THE EUROPEAN COMMISSION. Summary: Table Top, Field Exercises, Simulations, and Training (Test) for Cbrn Risk Mitigation-P106. Description: Facility for supporting the organization of table top, field exercises, simulation and training in the CBRN risk mitigation field. The geographic scope is "global". These exercises serve the purpose to test both the capacities acquired through the regional projects implemented under the EU CBRN programme and the functioning of the equipment delivered to the partner countries. The services provided will include drafting of scenarios, logistical support, production of visibility material, observation and evaluation of the performance of the exercises, recommendation and training if needed. The project can support also specific ad hoc high level trainings that are not provided through the usual regional projects. <br> Doc Title: Training services in defence and security materials <br> Contract Type: Services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: IMIO. Summary: Purchasing Center for Support Services in Terms of Cybersecurity. Description: The objective of this project, passed in the form of a framework agreement with a view to establishing a central purchasing office for this market, for the benefit of the Walloon local authorities, is to provide them with a catalog of equipment (equipment and software) and services allowing them to preserve the continuity of sservice of their missions and the protection of their citizens' data.<br> This contract is made up of separate lots covering a range of services related to cybersecurity, including:<br> Lot A1: Drafting and support for the implementation of security policies <br> Lot A2: Vulnerability assessmentand "Pen-tests"<br> Lot A3: Phishing/vishing/social engineering test campaign<br> Lot A4: Cyber threat intelligence<br> Lot A5: Dpd/dpo support on request<br> Lot A6: RSSI as a service<br> As the cybersecurity threat landscape is constantly changing, local authoritiesmust be able to face these challenges to guarantee their resilience and protect their interests and those of their citizens. This call for tenders is the result of the major audit campaign carried out in recent months with the aim of setting up a common defense base for theWallonia. The objective of this market is to provide the municipalities and CPAS of Wallonia with a complete and personalized cybersecurity solution that will meet their specific needs in terms of protection against cyber threats.<br> Doc Title: Investigation and security services<br> Contract Type: .. .. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: IMIO. Summary: Purchasing Center for Support Services in Terms of Cybersecurity. Description: The objective of this project, passed in the form of a framework agreement with a view to establishing a central purchasing office for this market, for the benefit of the Walloon local authorities, is to provide them with a catalog of equipment (equipment and software) and services allowing them to preserve the continuity of sservice of their missions and the protection of their citizens' data.<br> This contract is made up of separate lots covering a range of services related to cybersecurity, including:<br> Lot A1: Drafting and support for the implementation of security policies <br> Lot A2: Vulnerability assessmentand "Pen-tests"<br> Lot A3: Phishing/vishing/social engineering test campaign<br> Lot A4: Cyber threat intelligence<br> Lot A5: Dpd/dpo support on request<br> Lot A6: RSSI as a service<br> As the cybersecurity threat landscape is constantly changing, local authoritiesmust be able to face these challenges to guarantee their resilience and protect their interests and those of their citizens. This call for tenders is the result of the major audit campaign carried out in recent months with the aim of setting up a common defense base for theWallonia. The objective of this market is to provide the municipalities and CPAS of Wallonia with a complete and personalized cybersecurity solution that will meet their specific needs in terms of protection against cyber threats.<br> Doc Title: Investigation and security services<br> Contract Type: .. .. Published Date: 2023-07-29. Closing Date: 2023-08-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Purchasing Center for Support Services in Terms of Cybersecurity

This call for tenders is the result of the major audit campaign carried out in recent months with the aim of setting up a common defense base for theWallonia. The objective of this market is to provide the municipalities and CPAS of Wallonia with a complete and personalized cybersecurity solution that will meet their specific needs in terms of protection against cyber threats.<br> Doc Title: Investigation and security services<br> Contract Type: .. .

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: RW-SPW-SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT. Summary: Public Service Contract for the Provision of Services in Terms of Dashboard and Evaluation of the Evolution of Wallonia in Terms of the Circular Economy. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN UNION, REPRESENTED BY THE EUROPEAN COMMISSION. Summary: Table Top, Field Exercises, Simulations, and Training (Test) for Cbrn Risk Mitigation-P106. Description: Facility for supporting the organization of table top, field exercises, simulation and training in the CBRN risk mitigation field. The geographic scope is "global". These exercises serve the purpose to test both the capacities acquired through the regional projects implemented under the EU CBRN programme and the functioning of the equipment delivered to the partner countries. The services provided will include drafting of scenarios, logistical support, production of visibility material, observation and evaluation of the performance of the exercises, recommendation and training if needed. The project can support also specific ad hoc high level trainings that are not provided through the usual regional projects. <br> Doc Title: Training services in defence and security materials <br> Contract Type: Services.
