input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BEVEREN-SINT-GILLIS-WAAS-STEKENE POLICE ZONE. Summary: Framework Agreement with an Entrepreneur for Delivery, Installation, Maintenance and Expansion of the Camera Surveillance System and Associated Data Related Services. Description: Framework agreement of 4 years for the purchase of additional camera systems and 8 years for the maintenance of the existing installation. The existing installation is made up of a camera network of different camera brands and camera types, connected to different servers across the differentbuildings, linked to a fiber optic network and/or microwave connections.<br> Through this framework agreement, the Waasland-Noord Police Zone wishes to consolidate the current camera network and possibly further expand it by allowing it to grow in a future-oriented way through camera-related services, with the aim ofadds additional ANPR functionalities, speed measurement, image analysis, counting (real-time and post) and other new techniques that become possible. AI applications can also be added throughout the duration of the window contact. <br> The tenderer must be fully aware of thatthe emphasis is on expanding, renewing and maintaining the existing camera network in the Waasland-Noord Police Zone. The tenderer guarantees the maintenance of the existing camera network and, by extension, the camera networks of the current and possibly future linkedauthorities of the police zone.<br> An inventory of the existing installation is included in appendix A.<br> This framework agreement is open to all other authorities of cities, municipalities and police zones in Flanders in the form of a purchasing centre. The total estimate of this framework agreement.... Published Date: 2023-06-03. Closing Date: 2023-07-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

AI applications can also be added throughout the duration of the window contact. <br> The tenderer must be fully aware of thatthe emphasis is on expanding, renewing and maintaining the existing camera network in the Waasland-Noord Police Zone. The tenderer guarantees the maintenance of the existing camera network and, by extension, the camera networks of the current and possibly future linkedauthorities of the police zone.<br> An inventory of the existing installation is included in appendix A.<br> This framework agreement is open to all other authorities of cities, municipalities and police zones in Flanders in the form of a purchasing centre. Description: The overall objective of the call for tenders is to outsource the set-up of an end-to-end system and service demonstration of the Search and Rescue / Galileo (SAR/Galileo) Return Link Service (RLS) Two Way Communication (TWC) services. Summary: Follow-Up Study on the Application of the Directive on the Enforcement of Intellectual Property Rights (Ipred) and Contribution to the Eu Toolbox against Counterfeiting. Description: The study will assess how certain measures provided by IPRED are used in the different Member States, considering the EU COM(2017) 708 final. It will provide policy recommendations on improvements to ensure that full advantage is taken of IPRED in the fight against counterfeiting. The study will address the Commission s commitment in the IP Action Plan to ensure that injunctions are applied uniformly and efficiently across Member States, especially on the proportionality principle. Emphasis will be put on e.g. dynamic injunctions. The study will complement to the study on dynamic blocking injunctions in the EU published by the EUIPO in March 2021. The study will assess how to further strengthen the efficiency and effectiveness of the current enforcement framework, which could serve as a basis for the EU Toolbox against counterfeiting. It will also identify legal differences, gaps and any other obstacles precluding an effective cross border enforcement and cooperation within the EU. <br> Doc Title: Follow-up study on the Application of the Directive on the Enforcement of Intellectual Property Rights (IPRED) and Contribution to the EU Toolbox Against Counterfeiting <br> Contract Type: Services. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2023-03-31. Closing Date: 2024-03-31. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR INTERNAL MARKET, INDUSTRY, ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND SMES (GROW), GROW.C.4 - INTANGIBLE ECONOMY
output.Summary: Follow-Up Study on the Application of the Directive on the Enforcement of Intellectual Property Rights (Ipred) and Contribution to the Eu Toolbox against Counterfeiting
output.Description: The study will assess how certain measures provided by IPRED are used in the different Member States, considering the EU COM(2017) 708 final. It will provide policy recommendations on improvements to ensure that full advantage is taken of IPRED in the fight against counterfeiting. The study will address the Commission s commitment in the IP Action Plan to ensure that injunctions are applied uniformly and efficiently across Member States, especially on the proportionality principle. Emphasis will be put on e.g. dynamic injunctions. The study will complement to the study on dynamic blocking injunctions in the EU published by the EUIPO in March 2021. The study will assess how to further strengthen the efficiency and effectiveness of the current enforcement framework, which could serve as a basis for the EU Toolbox against counterfeiting. It will also identify legal differences, gaps and any other obstacles precluding an effective cross border enforcement and cooperation within the EU. <br> Doc Title: Follow-up study on the Application of the Directive on the Enforcement of Intellectual Property Rights (IPRED) and Contribution to the EU Toolbox Against Counterfeiting <br> Contract Type: Services

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: UNIVERSITY OF LIEGE. Summary: Supply of Mechanical Parts for the Csl Co2m-Fsc Project. Description: The subject of this contract is the supply of mechanical parts for the various models of the FCU to be developed by the CSL for Thales Alenia Space.<br> The FCU instrument is made up of numerous elements, in different materials, which must be supplied in order to be able to assemble the different modselements of the FCU before delivery to the customer.<br> The contract is presented in two lots:<br> -Lot 1: simple, semi-complex parts<br> -Lot 2: complex parts.<br> The tenderer may submit an offer either as a direct supplier , or as an intermediary, at no additional cost.<br> Doc Title: Engines and engine parts for military aerospace equipment<br> Contract Type: Supplies. Published Date: 2023-02-03. Closing Date: 2023-03-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
